Event.name: Launch_process
Event.definition:
<def-root>An <fen>Agent</fen> acts to begin the life of a <fex name="Process">Process</fex>.
<ex><fex name="Time">After discovering her knack for organization</fex>, <fex name="Agent">she decided to try to </fex> <t>launch</t> <fex name="Process">a career in human resources</fex>.</ex>
<ex><fex name="Agent">The City of Bratislava</fex> has <t>launched</t> <fex name="Process">a pilot project of providing internet access in the city centre</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Process
Arg.definition: <def-root>This Frame Element marks expressions that indicate the process that the <fen>Agent</fen> initiates.</def-root>

Arg.name: Place
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the <fen>Process</fen> is initiated. </def-root>

Arg.name: Means
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Means</fen> is the way in which the <fen>Agent</fen> initiates the <fen>Process</fen>.</def-root>

Arg.name: Time
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE is for the <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Agent</fen> initiates the <fen>Process</fen>.</def-root>

Arg.name: Medium
Arg.definition: <def-root><fen>Medium</fen> is the physical or abstract setting in which the <fen>Agent</fen> initiates the <fen>Process</fen>.</def-root>

Arg.name: Agent
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Agent</fen> is the actor responsible for starting the <fen>Process</fen>.</def-root>

Arg.name: Purpose
Arg.definition: <def-root>To what end the <fen>Agent</fen> initiates the <fen>Process</fen>.</def-root>

Arg.name: Co-timed_event
Arg.definition:
<def-root>This FE identifies the first <fen>Co-timed_event</fen> of the started <fen>Process</fen>.
</def-root>

Arg.name: Manner
Arg.definition: <def-root>The way in which the <fen>Agent</fen> initiates the <fen>Process</fen>.</def-root>

Arg.name: Communicative_force
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE indicates the <fen>Communicative_force</fen> or authority with which the target operates (often denoted by words such as "officially," "formally," "technically," etc.). </def-root>

Arg.name: Explanation
Arg.definition: <def-root>The reason why or the way in which the <fen>Agent</fen> initiates the <fen>Process</fen>.</def-root>

Arg.name: Circumstances
Arg.definition: <def-root>The state of the world at the time when the <fen>Agent</fen> produces the <fen>Process</fen>.</def-root>

Arg.name: Particular_iteration
Arg.definition: <def-root>Expressions marked with this extra-thematic FE modify a non-iterative use of the target, and indicate that it is conceived as embedded within an iterated series of similar events or states. In addition, most expressions of Particular_iteration indicate which instance of the series is being referred to.</def-root>

Arg.name: New_situation
Arg.definition: <def-root>A consecutive event to the starting of the <fen>Process</fen> of the <fen>Agent</fen>.</def-root>

Arg.name: Containing_event
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE denotes an event that occurs or state of affairs that holds at a time that includes the time during which the event or state of affairs reported by the target occurs and of which it is taken to be a part.</def-root>

Arg.name: Concessive
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE signifies that the state of affairs expressed by the main clause (containing the target) occurs or holds, and something other than that state of affairs would be expected given the state of affairs in the concessive clause. </def-root>

Arg.name: Depictive
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Depictive</fen> phrase describing the actor or undergoer of an action.</def-root>

Arg.name: Event_description
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE applies to appraisals of the event, typically a judgment of its expectedness.</def-root>

Arg.name: Beneficiary
Arg.definition: <def-root>The party for who's benefit the <fen>Process</fen> is launched. </def-root>

Arg.name: Re-encoding
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE presents the current frame as an integral part of a larger conceptualization expressed by another frame. The frame expressed by the target typically corresponds to a Means action within the frame expressed by the <fex name="Re-encoding">Re-encoding</fex>, but not necessarily</def-root>

Arg.name: Frequency
Arg.definition: <def-root>How often the <fen>Process</fen> is launched.</def-root>
